    Join current query to another omop table

    omop_join.Rd

    Simple wrapper for join functions to join an existing query to another table in the omop cdm (or any other of the same source). Include the following two lines at the top of your script after setting the schema and connection

    options(con.default.value = connection_variable_name)

    options(schema.default.value = cdm_schema_variable_name)

    omop_join(
  data,
  table,
  type,
  con = getOption("con.default.value"),
  schema = getOption("schema.default.value"),
  ...
)

    Arguments

    data

    sql query from dbplyr/dplyr. this function works in pipes!

    table

    the omop table (or other table in your schema) you wish to join

    type

    the type of join. use types available in dplyr: left, right, inner, anti, full etc.

    con

    defaults to the connection you set with options(). does not need to be specified

    schema

    defaults to the schema you set with options(). does not need to be specified.

    ...

    arguments passed on to the join function. e.g., by = "person_id"

    Value

    more sql query info stuff

    Examples

    options(con.default.value = con)
#> Error in options(con.default.value = con): object 'con' not found
options(schema.default.value = cdm_schema)
#> Error in options(schema.default.value = cdm_schema): object 'cdm_schema' not found
obs_tbl |>
  omop_join("person", type = "left", by = "person_id")
#> Error in omop_join(obs_tbl, "person", type = "left", by = "person_id"): Remember to set the connection and schema defaults. see ?omop_join for details
